intro: Panicum beyeri, commonly known as the red panicgrass, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and dense, reddish-purple inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is often used in ornamental horticulture for its striking color and drought tolerance. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to ecological restoration projects in arid regions.
